sections.title: About IMPROVE
sections.content: IMPROVE offers seven quick strategies to help you cope with intense emotions in the moment. It stands for: **Imagery** (visualizing calm or empowering scenes), **Meaning** (finding purpose in the experience), **Prayer** (spiritual connection), **Relaxation** (calming your body), **One thing in the moment** (deep focus on one activity), **Vacation** (a brief mental or physical break), and **Encouragement** (supportive self-talk). Each option gives you a different way to feel grounded and comforted during emotional overwhelm.

sections.title: Example
sections.content: After a tense talk with their parents, Sai felt overwhelmed and reactive. Using IMPROVE, they pictured a peaceful mountain trail (Imagery), reminded themselves these conversations help them grow (Meaning), said a quiet prayer (Prayer), relaxed their body (Relaxation), focused on folding a blanket (One thing), stepped outside to listen to birds (Vacation), and told themselves "I'm doing the best I can" (Encouragement). These steps helped Sai feel calmer and more in control.

sections.title: Remember
sections.content: IMPROVE isn't about making everything perfect. It's about finding small, meaningful ways to bring comfort and care to yourself when you need it mostâ€”one small step at a time.
